Bosnia and Herzegovina: On the establishment of a Preliminary Open List of In...

Bosnia and Herzegovina: On the establishment of a Preliminary Open List of In...UNESCO Venice Office

SESSION 1 Eighth Annual Meeting of the South East European Experts Network on Intangible Cultural Heritage 15-16 May 2014. Limassol, Cyprus Author: Dragica Panić-Kašanski, National Commission of Bosnia and Herzegovina for UNESCO DISCLAIMER The ideas and opinions expressed in the above presentations are not necessarily those of UNESCO and do not commit the Organization. The designations employed and the presentation of material throughout the documents do not imply the expression of any opinion whatsoever on the part of UNESCO concerning the legal status of any country, territory, city of area or of its authorities or concerning the delimitation of its frontiers or boundaries.

B3191ab4

Lina Kostenko is a renowned Ukrainian poet and writer born in 1930. She was one of the first poets of the 1960s generation in Ukraine who created a new avant-garde style in Ukrainian literature. However, as a dissident writer who was critical of the Soviet regime, many of her works were banned from publication. Only after the 1970s were some of her poems and novels published, including "On the Banks of the Eternal River" and "Mary Churai," for which she received the Shevchenko Prize in 1987. Kostenko continues writing and publishing into the 21st century and has received numerous honors for her significant contributions to Ukrainian literature.

B3191ab4

Lina Kostenko is a renowned Ukrainian poet and writer born in 1930. She was one of the first poets of the "Sixties" generation that introduced new avant-garde styles to Ukrainian literature in the 1950s-1960s. However, as a dissident writer who was critical of the Soviet regime, many of her works were banned from publication. Only after the 1970s were some of her poems and novels published, including "On the Banks of the Eternal River" and "Mary Churai," for which she received the Shevchenko Prize in 1987. Kostenko continues writing and publishing into the 21st century and has received numerous honors for her significant contributions to Ukrainian literature.

Taras shevchenko -_vdovkina_sveta

Taras shevchenko -_vdovkina_svetaJulia Birhova

Taras Shevchenko was a Ukrainian poet and artist born in 1814 in the Russian Empire. He is considered the founder of modern Ukrainian literature. As a serf, he was apprenticed as a painter and eventually gained his freedom. He published his first collection of poems in 1840 which helped establish Ukrainian as a literary language. However, he was later exiled for his nationalist views and banned from writing until 1857. Shevchenko died in 1861 and is revered in Ukraine as an important figure in their history and culture. He is commemorated through many monuments and institutions throughout Ukraine and former Soviet states.

Prezentatsia microsoft office_power_point chinkov

Prezentatsia microsoft office_power_point chinkovJulia Birhova

Taras Shevchenko was a Ukrainian poet and artist in the 19th century who is considered the founder of modern Ukrainian literature. He was born a serf in 1814 in the Russian Empire and faced much hardship as an orphaned serf before gaining his freedom. He went on to study art in Saint Petersburg and produced many masterpieces as a painter while also writing poetry. However, he was arrested and exiled for his nationalist views expressed in his poetry. Shevchenko had a huge impact on Ukrainian culture and literature and is revered as one of the most important figures in Ukrainian history.

We are still making this world a better place

We are still making this world a better placeSanja Stanković

The document provides information on several topics related to Serbia: - Vuk Stefanović Karadžić was a Serbian philologist and linguist who was the major reformer of the Serbian language and is considered the father of Serbian folklore studies. - Ivo Andrić was a Yugoslav novelist and short story writer who won the 1961 Nobel Prize in Literature. His writings dealt mainly with life in Bosnia under Ottoman rule. - Novak Djokovic is a Serbian professional tennis player who is currently ranked world no. 1 by the ATP. He has won five Grand Slam singles titles and is considered one of the greatest tennis players of all time.
